definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Temperature and precipitation levels have influenced many major events in history.
sentences.chinese: 氣溫和降水量對歷史上的許多重大事件產生過影響。

sentences.english: The province normally averages slightly above 3 feet for an entire year.
sentences.chinese: 而該省的年平均降水量一般爲3英尺。

sentences.english: There is also a positive correlation between the autumn and spring precipitation and the yield of winter wheat in dry farmlands at 90% significant level.
sentences.chinese: 旱作區冬小麥產量與秋春季降水量呈較顯著的正相關。

sentences.english: The changes of precipitations were not obvious with reducing precipitations in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 降水量的變化不明顯，但秋季降水有減少的趨勢。

sentences.english: The Amazonian south and southeast will receive much less rainfall.
sentences.chinese: 亞馬遜東部和東南部的降水量將顯著減少。

sentences.english: Those places which have over 250mm rainfall are near the Mediterranean Sea .
sentences.chinese: 靠近地中海的地區降水量超過了250毫米。

sentences.english: There is generally more evaporation over the oceans and more precipitation over the land.
sentences.chinese: 通常在海洋蒸發量較大，而陸地上則降水量較大。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the annual precipitation of China is slightly less than the climatology .
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，全國平均年降水量較常年略偏少。

sentences.english: Average precipitation is not more than 140 mm annually.
sentences.chinese: 年平均降水量不足140毫米。

sentences.english: In the JRA product, the rainfall over coastal regions of South China is overestimated.
sentences.chinese: JRA資料高估了華南沿海地區的降水量。

sentences.english: The annual runoff of the Lanjiang River Basin keeps the same trend as the annual precipitation.
sentences.chinese: 蘭江流域年徑流深與年降水量基本保持同步變化。

sentences.english: The yearly variations of seasonal precipitations in winter and spring were quite consistent with each other.
sentences.chinese: 冬春季降水量的逐年變化存在顯著的同相關係。

sentences.english: But the precipitation was too small to supplement the water deficit in the lake.
sentences.chinese: 但是降水量太少無法補充湖中的缺水量。

sentences.english: In Tongcheng county, precipitation topped 300 mm within four hours, a record volume.
sentences.chinese: 在桐城縣，降水量超過四小時內，創下量300毫米。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the region gets just 75 millimeters (three inches) of rain each year.
sentences.chinese: 同時，該地區每年降水量也只是75毫米。

sentences.english: Rainfall is down by up to  100% on the same period last year.
sentences.chinese: 該地區的降水量較去年同期減少了100個百分比。

definition: the state of moisture in the soil (and whether it can support a crop)
